result.execSummary:
The defendant John T Ciszewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 187 Days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with the Pick N Save on Silvernail Road or with any victims listed in the criminal complaint or their residences. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain full time employment and/or school. 
Comply with Day Report Center for 120 days after Huber sentence. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Commencing forthwith. As a condition of probation, Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. NEXT 60 Days are STAYED for use at agent's discretion. LAST 120 Days are to be served with the Day Report Center.
Concurrent with: Present Huber sentence.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant John T Ciszewski in court with Attorney Katie B Bricco.  Mary C Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 (Repeater enhancer is striken).  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentending recommendations. Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE:   

3 1/2 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 187 days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Pick n Save on Silvernail Rd in Waukesha or with any victims listed in criminal complaint or their residences
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____120 Days Day Report Center (see below condition time ordered)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of bail money posted - remainder to be returned to person who posted it)

CONDITION TIME:  9 MONTHS HUBER,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions - last 60 days STAYED (to be used at agent's discretion) and last 120 days of condition time is to be at Day Report Center
(Orig.) Dated 06/25/14, from the State to Judge Carter, regarding sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 2, 2014 at 10:15 am.
